quotes.quote: Who made the world I cannot tell; 'Tis made, and here am I in hell. My hand, though now my knuckles bleed, I never soiled with such a deed.
quotes.author: A.E. Housman

quotes.quote: Yield gracefully when someone cuts in line. You can then stab them in the back.
quotes.author: Ka'a Orto'o

quotes.quote: Scientology: Cornering the idiot market since 1958.
Health is merely the slowest possible rate at which one can die.
You can fool too many of the people too much of the time.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: Ethics are so annoying. I avoid them on principle.
quotes.author: Darby Conley

quotes.quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
quotes.author: Ralph W. Sockman

quotes.quote: So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: Equations are the devil's sentences.
quotes.author: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report

quotes.quote: I don't want someone shoving his views down my throat, unless they're covered in a crunchy candy shell.
quotes.author: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report, May 2, 2006

quotes.quote: The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is inefficiency. An efficient bureaucracy is the greatest threat to liberty.
quotes.author: Eugene McCarthy, Time magazine, Feb. 12, 1979

quotes.quote: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.
quotes.author: Cullen Hightower

quotes.quote: We hate some persons because we do not know them; and we will not know them because we hate them.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: The shortest distance between two points is under construction.
quotes.author: Noelie Altito

quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.author: Lenin

quotes.quote: Bureaucrats write memoranda both because they appear to be busy when they are writing and because the memos, once written, immediately become proof that they were busy.
quotes.author: Charles Peters

quotes.quote: I tend to live in the past because most of my life is there.
quotes.author: Herb Caen

quotes.quote: It may be that the old astrologers had the truth exactly reversed, when they believed that the stars controlled the destinies of men. The time may come when men control the destinies of stars.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke, First on the Moon, 1970

quotes.quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke, "Profiles of The Future", 1961 (Clarke's third law)

quotes.quote: Nature is trying very hard to make us succeed, but nature does not depend on us. We are not the only experiment.
quotes.author: R. Buckminster Fuller, Interview, April 30, 1978

quotes.quote: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say that the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: If you can find something everyone agrees on, it's wrong.
quotes.author: Mo Udall

quotes.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison, (attributed)

quotes.quote: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
quotes.author: Barry LePatner

quotes.quote: Drinking makes such fools of people, and people are such fools to begin with, that it's compounding a felony.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
quotes.author: George F. Will

quotes.quote: The best way to keep one's word is not to give it.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: People will buy anything that is one to a customer.
quotes.author: Sinclair Lewis

quotes.quote: I know that you believe that you understood what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant.
quotes.author: Robert McCloskey, State Department spokesman (attributed)

quotes.quote: The thing that impresses me the most about America is the way parents obey their children.
quotes.author: King Edward VIII

quotes.quote: I stand by all the misstatements that I've made.
quotes.author: Dan Quayle, to Sam Donaldson, 8/17/89

quotes.quote: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.
quotes.author: Steven Weinberg, quoted in The New York Times, April 20, 1999

quotes.quote: Whatever you do will be insignificant, but it is very important that you do it.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Armando Garcia J, December 11, 1985

quotes.quote: We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: You can know the name of a bird in all the languages of the world, but when you're finished, you'll know absolutely nothing whatever about the bird... So let's look at the bird and see what it's doing -- that's what counts. I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself - and you are the easiest person to fool.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman, Caltech commencement address, 1974

quotes.quote: There is no harm in doubt and skepticism, for it is through these that new discoveries are made.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Armando Garcia J, December 11, 1985

quotes.quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: My wife and I were happy for twenty years. Then we met.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.quote: I think it is good that books still exist, but they do make me sleepy.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Anybody who watches three games of football in a row should be declared brain dead.
quotes.author: Erma Bombeck

quotes.quote: The only way to entertain some folks is to listen to them.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: It's a dangerous business going out your front door.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

quotes.quote: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

quotes.quote: All that is gold does not glitter; not all those that wander are lost.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring, 1954

quotes.quote: One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring, 1954, chapter 2

quotes.quote: Many that live deserve death. And some die that deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then be not too eager to deal out death in the name of justice, fearing for your own safety. Even the wise cannot see all ends.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Lord Of the Rings, Book Four, Chapter One

quotes.quote: Never face facts; if you do, you'll never get up in the morning.
quotes.author: Marlo Thomas

quotes.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.quote: One man alone can be pretty dumb sometimes, but for real bona fide stupidity, there ain't nothin' can beat teamwork.
quotes.author: Edward Abbey

quotes.quote: There is no human problem which could not be solved if people would simply do as I advise.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: The Constitution gives every American the inalienable right to make a damn fool of himself.
quotes.author: John Ciardi

quotes.quote: What the world needs is more geniuses with humility, there are so few of us left.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: The perfect bureaucrat everywhere is the man who manages to make no decisions and escape all responsibility.
quotes.author: Brooks Atkinson, Once Around the Sun, 1951

quotes.quote: You cannot depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
quotes.author: Mark Twain, A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

quotes.quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: A specification that will not fit on one page of 8.5x11 inch paper cannot be understood.
quotes.author: Mark Ardis

quotes.quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw, Everybody's Political What's What? (1944) ch. 30

quotes.quote: Why is it that our memory is good enough to retain the least triviality that happens to us, and yet not good enough to recollect how often we have told it to the same person?
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: It is of interest to note that while some dolphins are reported to have learned English -- up to fifty words used in correct context -- no human being has been reported to have learned dolphinese.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: All of the books in the world contain no more information than is broadcast as video in a single large American city in a single year. Not all bits have equal value.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: In every country, we should be teaching our children the scientific method and the reasons for a Bill of Rights. With it comes a certain decency, humility and community spirit. In the demon-haunted world that we inhabit by virtue of being human, this may be all that stands between us and the enveloping darkness.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep insights can be winnowed from deep nonsense.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: In science it often happens that scientists say, 'You know that's a really good argument; my position is mistaken,' and then they would actually change their minds and you never hear that old view from them again. They really do it. It doesn't happen as often as it should, because scientists are human and change is sometimes painful. But it
happens every day. I cannot recall the last time someting like that happened in politics or religion.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan, 1987 CSICOP Keynote Address

quotes.quote: Where we have strong emotions, we're liable to fool ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan, Cosmos (Blues for a Red Planet)

quotes.quote: Ordinarily he was insane, but he had lucid moments when he was merely stupid.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous, he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln, (attributed)

quotes.quote: God is not dead but alive and well and working on a much less ambitious project.
quotes.author: Anonymous, Graffito

quotes.quote: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.
quotes.author: William Goldman, "The Princess Bride"

quotes.quote: Oh, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to believe.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter, misquoting Sir Walter Scott

quotes.quote: The significant problems we have cannot be solved at the same level of thinking with which we created them.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

quotes.quote: In heaven all the interesting people are missing.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: All animals are equal but some animals are more equal than others.
quotes.author: George Orwell, "Animal Farm"

quotes.quote: There are two kinds of light--the glow that illuminates, and the glare that obscures.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing but a lot of ignorance is just as bad.
quotes.author: Bob Edwards

quotes.quote: Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information on it.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson, quoted in Boswell's Life of Johnson

quotes.quote: The enemy is anybody who's going to get you killed, no matter which side he's on.
quotes.author: Joseph Heller, Catch 22

quotes.quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: The first question I ask myself when something doesn't seem to be beautiful is why do I think it's not beautiful. And very shortly you discover that there is no reason.
quotes.author: John Cage

quotes.quote: There's always somebody who is paid too much, and taxed too little - and it's always somebody else.
quotes.author: Cullen Hightower

quotes.quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection, the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
quotes.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quotes.quote: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: Read, every day, something no one else is reading. Think, every day, something no one else is thinking. Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do. It is bad for the mind to be always part of unanimity.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: It takes hundreds of nuts to hold a car together, but it takes only one of them to scatter it all over the highway.
quotes.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

quotes.quote: The most erroneous stories are those we think we know best - and therefore never scrutinize or question.
quotes.author: Stephen Jay Gould

quotes.quote: A superstition is a premature explanation that overstays its time.
quotes.author: George Iles

quotes.quote: A committee is a cul-de-sac down which ideas are lured and then quietly strangled.
quotes.author: Sir Barnett Cocks

quotes.quote: The most common of all follies is to believe passionately in the palpably not true. It is the chief occupation of mankind.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Ninety percent of everything is crap.
quotes.author: Theodore Sturgeon

quotes.quote: Sometimes the appropriate response to reality is to go insane.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick, Valis

quotes.quote: On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog.
quotes.author: Peter Steiner, cartoon in The New Yorker, July 5, 1993

quotes.quote: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein, "Geometry and Experience", January 27, 1921

quotes.quote: Much of the social history of the Western world over the past three decades has involved replacing what worked with what sounded good.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell, Is Reality Optional?, 1993

quotes.quote: When buying and selling are controlled by legislation, the first things to be bought and sold are legislators.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.quote: Disobedience, in the eyes of anyone who has read history, is man's original virtue. It is through disobedience and rebellion that progress has been made.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of Man Under Socialism

quotes.quote: Love thy neighbour as yourself, but choose your neighbourhood.
quotes.author: Louise Beal

quotes.quote: Whenever I dwell for any length of time on my own shortcomings, they gradually begin to seem mild, harmless, rather engaging little things, not at all like the staring defects in other people's characters.
quotes.author: Margaret Halsey

quotes.quote: We rarely think people have good sense unless they agree with us.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld, Maximes (1678)

quotes.quote: After the last of 16 mounting screws has been removed from an access cover, it will be discovered that the wrong access cover has been removed.
quotes.author: De La Lastra's Law

quotes.quote: We live in a Newtonian world of Einsteinian physics ruled by Frankenstein logic.
quotes.author: David Russell

quotes.quote: The only good ideas are the ones I can take credit for.
quotes.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 11-13-06

quotes.quote: But in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin, Letter to Jean Baptiste Le Roy (1789)

quotes.quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
quotes.author: Clare Booth Luce

quotes.quote: Our national flower is the concrete cloverleaf.
quotes.author: Lewis Mumford

quotes.quote: Basic research is what I am doing when I don't know what I am doing.
quotes.author: Wernher von Braun

quotes.quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Nothing is as simple as we hope it will be.
quotes.author: Jim Horning

quotes.quote: Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day. Teach a man to fish and he will eat for a lifetime. Teach a man to create an artificial shortage of fish and he will eat steak.
quotes.author: Jay Leno

quotes.quote: The significant problems we have cannot be solved at the same level of thinking with which we created them.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

quotes.quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: Gratitude is merely the secret hope of further favors.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin (1973) "Personal Conduct"

quotes.quote: The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Taylor

quotes.quote: Physicists like to think that all you have to do is say, these are the conditions, now what happens next?
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: Idealism is what precedes experience; cynicism is what follows.
quotes.author: David T. Wolf

quotes.quote: Youth would be an ideal state if it came a little later in life.
quotes.author: Herbert Henry Asquith

quotes.quote: A classic is something that everybody wants to have read and nobody wants to read.
quotes.author: Mark Twain, Speech in New York, Nov. 20, 1900

quotes.quote: The great thing about television is that if something important happens anywhere in the world, day or night, you can always change the channel.
quotes.author: From "Taxi"

quotes.quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: The greatest of faults, I should say, is to be conscious of none.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: Adventure is just bad planning.
quotes.author: Roald Amundsen

quotes.quote: Don't knock the weather. If it didn't change once in a while, nine out of ten people couldn't start a conversation.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: Life is just one damned thing after another.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: A vacuum is a hell of a lot better than some of the stuff that nature replaces it with.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams, Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1955)

quotes.quote: Personally I'm always ready to learn, although I do not always like being taught.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: I do not fear computers. I fear the lack of them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.quote: Things are only impossible until they're not.
quotes.author: Jean-Luc Picard, 'Star Trek: The Next Generation'

quotes.quote: If winning isn't everything, why do they keep score?
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: The ultimate result of shielding men from the effects of folly is to fill the world with fools.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.quote: I have long been of the opinion that if work were such a splendid thing the rich would have kept more of it for themselves.
quotes.author: Bruce Grocott

quotes.quote: What luck for rulers that men do not think.
quotes.author: Adolf Hitler

quotes.quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
quotes.author: Thomas H. Huxley

quotes.quote: Freedom of the press is limited to those who own one.
quotes.author: A. J. Liebling

quotes.quote: With most men, unbelief in one thing springs from blind belief in another.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: Today's scientists have substituted mathematics for experiments, and they wander off through equation after equation, and eventually build a structure which has no relation to reality.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla, Modern Mechanics and Inventions, July, 1934

quotes.quote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

quotes.quote: The scientists of today think deeply instead of clearly. One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla, Modern Mechanics and Inventions. July, 1934

quotes.quote: If Edison had a needle to find in a haystack, he would proceed at once with the diligence of the bee to examine straw after straw until he found the object of his search... I was a sorry witness of such doings, knowing that a little theory and calculation would have saved him ninety per cent of his labor.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla, New York Times, October 19, 1931

quotes.quote: Never try to tell everything you know. It may take too short a time.
quotes.author: Norman Ford

quotes.quote: The covers of this book are too far apart.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce, The Devil's Dictionary

quotes.quote: We are bits of stellar matter that got cold by accident, bits of a star gone wrong.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: I phoned my dad to tell him I had stopped smoking. He called me a quitter.
quotes.author: Steven Pearl

quotes.quote: It is better to deserve honors and not have them than to have them and not to deserve them.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You can pretend to be serious; you can't pretend to be witty.
quotes.author: Sacha Guitry

quotes.quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: The world's as ugly as sin, and almost as delightful
quotes.author: Frederick Locker-Lampson

quotes.quote: Americans will put up with anything provided it doesn't block traffic.
quotes.author: Dan Rather

quotes.quote: Once the game is over, the King and the pawn go back in the same box.
quotes.author: Italian Proverb

quotes.quote: The people who are regarded as moral luminaries are those who forego ordinary pleasures themselves and find compensation in interfering with the pleasures of others.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The author of the Iliad is either Homer or, if not Homer, somebody else of the same name.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: I told my psychiatrist that everyone hates me. He said I was being ridiculous - everyone hasn't met me yet.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.quote: There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: When they discover the center of the universe, a lot of people will be disappointed to discover they are not it.
quotes.author: Bernard Bailey

quotes.quote: I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: No one has ever had an idea in a dress suit.
quotes.author: Sir Frederick G. Banting

quotes.quote: Accomplishing the impossible means only that the boss will add it to your regular duties.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: The average person thinks he isn't.
quotes.author: Father Larry Lorenzoni

quotes.quote: Advertisements... contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter to Nathaniel Macon, January 12, 1819

quotes.quote: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Hard work never killed anybody, but why take a chance?
quotes.author: Edgar Bergen, (Charlie McCarthy)

quotes.quote: In the part of this universe that we know there is great injustice, and often the good suffer, and often the wicked prosper, and one hardly knows which of those is the more annoying.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The men the American public admire most extravagantly are the most daring liars; the men they detest most violently are those who try to tell them the truth.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Against logic there is no armor like ignorance.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.
quotes.author: Henny Youngman

quotes.quote: If you believe everything you read, better not read.
quotes.author: Japanese Proverb

quotes.quote: Here's a rule I recommend: Never practice two vices at once.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.quote: If we couldn't laugh, we would all go insane.
quotes.author: Jimmy Buffett

quotes.quote: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.
quotes.author: Paul Gauguin

quotes.quote: Facts are stupid things.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Statistics: The only science that enables different experts using the same figures to draw different conclusions.
quotes.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

quotes.quote: Whatever you may be sure of, be sure of this, that you are dreadfully like other people.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.quote: We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead

quotes.quote: Sometimes what's right isn't as important as what's profitable.
quotes.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Prehistoric Ice Man, 1999

quotes.quote: Even if you do learn to speak correct English, whom are you going to speak it to?
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: The only thing I like about rich people is their money.
quotes.author: Nancy Astor

quotes.quote: The illegal we do immediately. The unconstitutional takes a little longer.
quotes.author: Henry Kissinger, New York Times, Oct. 28, 1973

quotes.quote: The problem with the designated driver program, it's not a desirable job, but if you ever get sucked into doing it, have fun with it. At the end of the night, drop them off at the wrong house.
quotes.author: Jeff Foxworthy

quotes.quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: As I grow older , I regret to say that a detestable habit of thinking seems to be getting a hold of me.
quotes.author: H. Rider Haggard, King Solomon's Mines

quotes.quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice; In practice, there is.
quotes.author: Chuck Reid

quotes.quote: There are more fools in the world than there are people.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: The only thing that sustains one through life is the consciousness of the immense inferiority of everybody else, and this is a feeling that I have always cultivated.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Remarkable Rocket"

quotes.quote: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.
quotes.author: Barry Switzer

quotes.quote: The point of living and of being an optimist, is to be foolish enough to believe the best is yet to come.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.quote: They always talk who never think.
quotes.author: Matthew Prior

quotes.quote: I think it's the duty of the comedian to find out where the line is drawn and cross it deliberately.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I--I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.
quotes.author: Robert Frost, The Road Not Taken

quotes.quote: Since we cannot know all that there is to be known about anything, we ought to know a little about everything.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: Sometimes you go to the circus - sometimes the circus comes to you!
quotes.author: Unknown
